intro: Diplocentrum congestum, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its dense, compact growth habit. The plant features velvety, dark green leaves and produces clusters of small, showy flowers in shades of white, pink, and purple. It is often cultivated as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and ability to thrive in indoor conditions. The species is also valued for its medicinal properties in traditional African medicine.
